text:
Assume that the mean monthly return on T-bills is 0.25% and that the mean monthly
return and standard deviation for the S&P 500 are 1.30% and 7.30%, respectively.
Using the T-bill return to represent the risk-free rate, as is common in practice,
compute and interpret the Sharpe ratio.
Answer:
Sharpe ratio =
_1.30 – 0.25
= 0.144
7.30
